meanings.definition: A long, straight entrance or passageway leading to a building or tomb.
meanings.sent1: The dromos to the ancient temple was lined with statues.
meanings.sent2: The tourists walked through the dromos to reach the pyramid.
meanings.sent3: The dromos was so long that it felt like a journey to another world.
meanings.sent4: The dromos stretched out like a welcoming arm to the visitors.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight at the end of the dromos beckoned like a promise of discovery.

meanings.definition: A racecourse or track for chariot racing in ancient Greece.
meanings.sent1: The dromos was filled with cheering spectators during the chariot race.
meanings.sent2: The chariots thundered down the dromos, kicking up dust.
meanings.sent3: The dromos echoed with the sounds of hooves and wheels in the race.
meanings.sent4: The dromos was a battleground for the skilled charioteers.
meanings.sent5: The excitement on the dromos was palpable as the race began.

meanings.definition: A corridor or hallway in a building.
meanings.sent1: The students hurried down the school dromos to get to class on time.
meanings.sent2: The dromos outside the office was decorated with potted plants.
meanings.sent3: The dromos was so quiet that even a whisper echoed down its length.
meanings.sent4: The dromos seemed to lead to endless possibilities beyond each door.
meanings.sent5: The dromos was a familiar path for the residents of the building.
